educations.schoolName: United States Military Academy at West Point

headline: Senior Operations Research Analyst
summary: Served for over 20 years in government service as an Army officer and federal employee focusing in program management, analysis, human resources, and marketing.

defaultPosition.description: Serves as a senior level analyst, identifying, formulating, and defining actual or potential problem areas, trends, and similar factors. Designs research and study methods. Develops, applies, and interprets appropriate models and methods in conducting operations research analysis. Recommends new or amended legislation, policies and/or procedures as they relate to efficiency and effectiveness within Enforcement and Removal Operations (ERO) strategic and operational activities.
defaultPosition.title: Senior Operations Research Analyst

positions.description: Serves as a senior level analyst, identifying, formulating, and defining actual or potential problem areas, trends, and similar factors. Designs research and study methods. Develops, applies, and interprets appropriate models and methods in conducting operations research analysis. Recommends new or amended legislation, policies and/or procedures as they relate to efficiency and effectiveness within Enforcement and Removal Operations (ERO) strategic and operational activities.
positions.title: Senior Operations Research Analyst

positions.description: Served as an Operations Research Analyst for the Joint Improvised-Threat Reduction Organization in support of Counter-Improvised Explosive Device and Counter-Unmanned Aerial System solutions and technologies by evaluating operational effectiveness through input to test and experiment designs, determining measures of effectiveness, applying risk analysis, analyzing empirical data, and obtaining objective data for acquisition decisions.
positions.title: Operations Research Analyst

positions.description: Served as the Deputy Director and Program Manager for the Office, Chief of Air Defense Artillery by recommending and executing personnel and human resources life-cycle management policy changes for Air Defense Artillery active and reserve component officers, warrant officers, and enlisted Soldiers.  Served as the branch focal point for marketing and enhancing the image of ADA across Army, branch, and civilian communities.
positions.title: Deputy Director and Program Manager

positions.description: Served as the Branch Chief for the Air and Missile Defense Branch within the Requirements Determination Division of the Fires Capabilities Development and Integration Directorate.  Performed duties as a senior analyst and team leader for 3-6 officers and civilians engaged in the research and evaluation of current and future air defense weapon systems.
positions.title: Operations Research Analyst

positions.description: Responsible for developing business opportunities in and around the Lawton-Fort Sill area. Establishesd a base of operations at Fort Sill to cover Army and Air Force contracts from Oklahoma City, OK to Wichita Falls, TX. Provided customer service to Army and Air Force agencies in the surrounding area. Coordinated with government and other contractors to provide the best products and personnel available.
positions.title: Business Development

positions.description: Deployed to Southwest Asia for Operation Enduring Freedom and Operation Iraqi Freedom.  Served as an Army Officer in multiple positions including Deputy Director for the Air and Missile Defense Battle Lab; Experimentation Branch Chief for the Air and Missile Defense Battle Lab; Brigade Adjutant; Brigade Assistant Operations Officer; Battery Commander; and the United States Military Academy Inspections Branch Chief.
positions.title: United States Army Officer
